title.narrative: EDUCATION MANAGEMENT BODIES STRENGTHENED

description.narrative: The national education management bodies, both central and decentralized, are strengthened., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Early Childhood Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022,children aged 3-15 years, girls and boys, are in a supportive environment and benefit from inclusive quality education that integrates local distinctiveness

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The national education management bodies, both central and decentralized, are strengthened.

description.narrative: Le cadre partenarial du ProDEG (Programme Décennal de l’Education en Guinée), réunissant le Gouvernement et les PTF, a été renforcé en 2020. Des efforts conjoints ont facilité la définition des mécanismes de gestion du Budget d’Affectation Spécial (BAS), retenu comme modalité de financement du ProDEG via un Fonds Commun de l’Education. La synergie d’actions du Groupe Sectoriel de l’Education élargi au Cluster Education, a facilité le développement, la validation et la mise en œuvre du plan de riposte sectoriel contre la COVID-19 ainsi que son Financement accéléré par le Partenariat Mondial pour l&39;Education (PME). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2021
